entry.dc:title: Intestinal function and morphology in strongyloidiasis
entry.dc:creator: Garcia F.
entry.prism:publicationName: American Journal of Tropical Medicine and Hygiene
entry.dc:description: Divergent available information on the capability of Strongyloides stercoralis to cause malabsorption prompted a long-term observation in which the nutritional state of the subjects was carefully defined. In spite of moderate to severe symptoms, well nourished patients, even with segmental jejunitis, did not show malabsorption. All patients presenting this parasitic infection with concomitant malnutrition showed absorptive defects. Abnormal absorption persisted in spite of parasitic cure when malnutrition was not immediately corrected, and disappeared with correction of the malnutrition even if parasitic infection was allowed to continue. The present experience indicates that the malabsorption syndrome seen in some cases of S. stercoralis infection is secondary to the concomitant malnutrition and not to the parasite per se.

entry.dc:title: Argipressin effect on uterine motility during menstruation | PAPEL DE ARGININA-VASOPRESINA (A.D.H.) EN LA REGULACION DE LA MOTILIDAD UTERINA DURANTE LA MENSTRUACION
entry.dc:creator: Cobo E.
entry.prism:publicationName: Revista Colombiana de Obstetricia y Ginecologia
entry.dc:description: Induced water diuresis blocks the central release of antidiuretic hormone (ADH) which is in turn supposed to play a role in the high uterine activity recorded during human menstruation. In order to further explore this possibility, the uterine and antidiuretic activities were studied and a water diuresis was induced in 27 normal menstruating women, before the insertion of an intrauterine contraceptive device. Shortly after the initiation of water overload a simultaneous inhibition of both uterine and antidiuretic activities was obtained. Additionally, the administration of ADH by I.V. infusion reestablished the uterine motility to normal values and the administration of oxytocine did not. It is suggested that ADH has a direct role in the control of uterine activity during human menstruation.

entry.dc:title: Effect of oral desamino oxytocin on uterine contractility during induction of labor | EFFECTO DE LA DESAMINO-OXITOCINA BUCAL SOBRE LA CONTRACTILIDAD UTERINA DURANTE LA INDUCCION DEL PARTO
entry.dc:creator: Rodriguez A.
entry.prism:publicationName: Revista Colombiana de Obstetricia y Ginecologia

entry.dc:title: Dipeptide hydrolase activity of the intestinal mucosa from protein malnourished adult patients and controls
entry.dc:creator: Gjessing E.
entry.dc:description: The activities of 4 dipeptide hydrolases (glycyl-L-leucine, L-alanyl-L-proline, glycyl-L-proline, and L-leucyl-β-naphthylamide hydrolase) and alkaline phosphatase were determined in the jejunal mucosa of malnourished adult patients on a basal diet and on a high-protein repletion diet, and in adult controls. Clinical laboratory determinations and mucosal parameters were determined in all subjects. All laboratory determinations improved markedly in patients receiving the protein repletion diet, whereas the mean enzyme activities and mucosal parameters showed no significant change. Four of the 5 enzymes determined in the controls (L-alanyl-L-proline, glycyl-L-proline, L-leucyl-β-naphthylamide hydrolase, and alkaline phosphatase) were significantly greater than in patients receiving a basal diet, whereas only glycyl-L-proline hydrolase and alkaline phosphatase were significantly larger when compared to patients on the repletion diet. The mucosal parameters of villus height and mucosal index of the controls were significantly greater than either group of patients. Four of the enzymes had a positive and significant correlation with both villus height and mucosal index. All enzymes studied in patients before and after the repletion diet had a negative correlation with respect to serum albumin and protein levels, as did villus height and mucosal index. L-leucyl-β-naphthylamide hydrolase and alkaline phosphatase had a positive and significant correlation. The activities of glycyl-L-leucine and L-alanyl-L-phenylalanine hydrolase and alkaline phosphatase in Colombian controls were low as compared to Swedish and American controls. Glycyl-L-leucine and alanyl-L-phenylalanine hydrolase were found to be unstable in mucosa homogenates maintained at 0 C.

entry.dc:title: Effect of batrachotoxin on the electroplax of electric eel: evidence for voltage dependent interaction with sodium channels
entry.dc:creator: Bartels Bernal E.
entry.prism:publicationName: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America
entry.dc:description: Batrachotoxin under certain conditions has a strong depolarizing effect on the innervated membrane of the monocellular electroplax preparation from the electric eel, Electrophorus electricus. No effect is observed when the toxin (50-200 nM) is applied to the resting membrane for periods up to 1 hr. However, if the membrane is exposed to batrachotoxin and the cell is subjected to stimulation at a stimulus voltage slightly above the threshold for action potential firing, a progressive prolongation of the action potential and concomitant progressive depolarization of the innervated membrane is observed. When the membrane is depolarized by 15-20 mV, a further abrupt all or none depolarization occurs, and the potential attains a steady state value between 0 and -10 mV. Brief stimulation of a cell in the presence of batrachotoxin is sufficient to define a batrachotoxin treated cell, even though negligible depolarization occurs. If depolarizing agents such as carbamoylcholine or potassium chloride are introduced to such a cell in concentrations that normally produce a 20-30 mV depolarization, the abrupt all or none depolarization immediately occurs. All or none depolarizations arising from either electrical stimulation or depolarizing agents are unaffected by d tubocurarine but are completely reversed by tetrodotoxin. Batrachotoxin thus appears to activate only the action potential sodium channels. In the batrachotoxin treated membrane, these channels can attain stable steady states in either a closed configuration at the normal resting potential or in an open configuration after complete depolarization. A striking hysteresis cycle thus can be generated, which is strongly indicative of a voltage dependent interaction of the toxin with the action potential sodium channels.

entry.dc:title: Sign of the unnatural-parity cylinder
entry.dc:creator: Millan J.
entry.dc:description: We explain the sign difference between the natural-parity and the unnatural-parity cylinder by using a Reggeon-loop model proposed previously by Chew and Rosenzweig. © 1977 The American Physical Society.

entry.dc:title: Role of bats in the ecology of paracoccidioides brasiliensis: The survival of paracoccidioides brasiliensis in the intestinal tract of frugivorous bat, artibeus lituratus
entry.dc:creator: Greer D.
entry.dc:description: The fruit-eating bat, Artibeus lituratus, was fed known quantities of viable yeast cells and mycelial particles of Paracoccidioides brasiliensis in an attempt to assess the role of this animal in the distribution of this agent in nature. Results of mycosel cultures of the stomach, upper intestine, lower intestine and rectum clearly showed that the fungal cells were unable to survive more than 8 hours in the digestive tract of the bat. The mycelial particles were more susceptible than the yeast and were killed before passing to the rectum. The fungus died rapidly in the voided fecal material. These findings indicate the improbability of isolating P. brasiliensis from the digestive tract of wild captured bats and show that A. lituratus probably plays no role in the distribution of this fungus in nature. © 1977 Informa UK Ltd All rights reserved: reproduction in whole or part not permitted.

entry.dc:title: Reduction of mortality in tuberculous meningitis by steroid therapy | REDUCAO DA MORTALIDADE NA MENINGITE TUBERCULOSA POR ESTEROIDETERAPIA
entry.dc:creator: Escobar J.

entry.dc:title: Effects of trivalent phosphorus compounds on vinyl polymerizations-V. Effects of solvents and tetraethylammonium bromide on the anionic polymerization of acrylonitrile initiated by triethyl phosphite
entry.dc:creator: Ogawa T.
entry.dc:description: The effects of solvents and added salts on the triethyl phosphite catalysed anionic polymerization of acrylonitrile are described. The initial rate of polymerization increased but the degree of polymerization decreased with increase in polarity of solvent, except for hexane and dimethylformamide. Tetraethyl ammonium bromide increased the rate of polymerization, probably due to exchange of the counter-cation between tetraethyl ammonium cation and the phosphonium cation. Addition of tetraethyl ammonium bromide also decreased the order with respect to the monomer for polymerization in acetonitrile. The polymerization in dimethylformamide was found to be approximately second order with respect to the monomer, independently of the added ions. © 1977.

entry.dc:title: Spontaneous abortion and aging of human ova and spermatozoa
entry.dc:creator: Guerrero R.

entry.dc:title: International pilot study on schizophrenia: its implications for Latin America | EL ESTUDIO PILOTO INTERNACIONAL SOBRE ESQUIZOFRENIA, SUS IMPLICACIONES PARA LA AMERICA LATINA
entry.dc:creator: Leon C.
entry.prism:publicationName: Acta Psiquiatrica y Psicologica de America Latina
entry.dc:description: This is a succinct description of the International Pilot Study on Schizophrenia, sponsored by the World Health Organization and conducted in field research centers located in 9 different countries. The main objective of this study was the development of standard procedures for case finding, assessment of damage caused by schizophrenia, and observation of the course and outcome of the disorder. Starting in 1968, groups of approximately 120 patients who met the criteria both for inclusion and exclusion were studied in each center. They were subject to study by means of several instruments and were given a clinical diagnosis. On that basis, comparative analyses within and between centers were conducted, as well as reliability tests for the procedures used. Two followups took place at 2 and 5 yr intervals in order to obtain information about the course and outcome of the cases. The emphasis of this presentation is placed on the findings at the Cali (Colombia) field research center and their comparison with the global results of centers in the rest of the world. In that context, the findings show that centers in developing countries are at least as capable of conducting research work as those in the developed countries. There is also the suggestion that mental disorders in developing countries apparently tend to more benign course and outcome.

entry.dc:title: Paracoccidiodomycosis (South American blastomycosis): General review and report of cases | LA PARACOCCIDIODOMYCOSE (BLASTOMYCOSE SUD-AMERICAINE): REVUE GENERALE ET PRESENTATION DE CAS
entry.dc:creator: Cabrera A.
entry.dc:description: The author describes 19 cases of paracoccidiodomycosis (South American blastomycosis). The fundamental epidemiologic and parasitologic aspects of the disease are explained. The varying anatomoclinical features are discussed and the role of the pathologist in the diagnosis of the disease (with an immunologic study) is pointed out. Histology also allows one to evaluate the effect of treatment. The strong fibrogenic tendency of these diseases is mentioned, which is best seen when a patient has not been treated for a sufficient length of time.

entry.dc:title: Etiology of respiratory tract infections in children in Cali, Colombia
entry.dc:creator: Escobar J.
entry.dc:description: One hundred eighty children hospitalized for acute respiratory disease were studied in Cali, Colombia. In the majority of patients, pneumonia was the reason for hospitalizaton and remained the final diagnosis. Fifty one cases of pneumonia of indeterminate etiology comprised the largest single diagnostic category, followed by 38 cases of pneumonia associated with measles, and 22 cases associated with serologic evidence of infection with other viral agents or Mycoplasma pneumoniae. Etiologic diagnosis could be assigned with a reasonable degree of confidence in 116 of the 180 patients (64%). The laboratory procedure found most likely to provide the etiologic diagnosis in this series was paired sera specimens for demonstration of rise in antibody titer against the common viral respiratory pathogens. Those most frequently implicated serologically as etiologic agents in th cases studied were, in order of decreasing frequency, measles, influenza, parainfluenza, and adenoviruses.

entry.dc:title: Cancer of the uterine cervix and repeated cesarean section | CANCER DE CERVIX UTERINO Y CESAREA A REPETICION
entry.dc:creator: Bueno M.
entry.prism:publicationName: Revista Colombiana de Obstetricia y Ginecologia

entry.dc:title: Antigoitrogenic effect of casein
entry.dc:creator: Gaitan E.
entry.dc:description: Epidemiological findings from the city of Cali, Colombia, support the hypothesis that water supply and iodine intake are not the only dietary factors which influence the magnitude of the goitre endemia. Experiments were conducted in rats to determine whether casein has a counteracting effect on the goitrogenic and antithyroid activities of methimazole (MMI) and goitrogenic water extracts (GWE) from the endemic area of the Cauca Valley. Female albino rats (Charles River, DC strain) 100-110 g initial weight, receiving 12 μg of iodine daily, were divided into 3 groups and put on special diets: protein free, 8% casein, or 60% casein, respectively. Each group (24 rats) was then divided into 3 subgroups. Subgroup one received goitrogen free water and was used as a control. Subgroup two was administered MMI, 50 μg/day/rat. Subgroup 3 was given per animal a daily amount of GWE equivalent in antithyroid potency to 50 μg of MMI. At 77 days, the thyroid glands were studied for weight, 131I uptake, and 127I concentration. Animals on the proteinfree diet showed significantly (P<0.05-<0.01) larger thyroid glands per 100 g body weight and lower thyroidal 4 h 131I uptake and 127I concentrations than rats on casein diets. These differences were significantly increased (P<0.01) by the administration of MMI and GWE. All the effects were completely reversed by the 60% casein diet showing no differences between control rats and those on MMI or GWE. Rats on 8% casein showed intermediate values between those of animals on protein free and 60% casein diets; differences were still present between the control as against the MMI or GWE groups. The results indicate that under these experimental conditions, a poor protein diet impairs the thyroidal transport of iodine, decreases its concentration in the thyroid and is accompanied by an enlargement of the gland. Under these circumstances, the action of thiourea like antithyroid agents is enhanced. The administration of protein reverses these alterations and decreases the action of such antithyroid agents. Whether the changes observed are due to a direct action of casein on the thyroid and/or to effects of malnutrition on the metabolism of antithyroid compounds remains to be determined.

entry.dc:title: Gastric cancer in Colombia. I. Cancer risk and suspect environmental agents
entry.dc:creator: Cuello C.
entry.prism:publicationName: Journal of the National Cancer Institute
entry.dc:description: A case-control study of patients discharged from hospitals revealed fourfold differences in geographic variation in stomach cancer risk within the Department of Narino (Colombia). Data from gastroscopic surveys of population groups, samples of water supplies, and urine and saliva in Narino also indicated a generally positive correlation among the following parameters: 1) gastric cancer risk, 2) prevalence of chronic atrophic gastritis and intestinal metaplasia, 3) nitrate content of well waters, and 4) nitrate excretion by the population. Urinary excretion reflected the ingestion of nitrates, and this implied a higher average intake of nitrates in the populations at high risk for stomach cancer. The Narino data could be construed as presumptive epidemiologic evidence for the role of nitrate availability in the etiology of stomach cancer.

entry.dc:title: Prevention of respiratory distress syndrome in premature infants. Comparative study of orciprenaline and betamethasone | PREVENCION DEL SINDROME DE DIFICULTAD RESPIRATORIA EN PREMATUROS. ESTUDIO COMPARATIVO ENTRE ORCIPRENALINA Y BETAMETASONA
entry.dc:creator: Cifuentes R.
entry.prism:publicationName: Revista Colombiana de Obstetricia y Ginecologia

entry.dc:title: Time effect upon prevalence of goiter in Cauca valley after salt iodization | ACCION DEL TIEMPO EN LA PREVALENCIA DE BOCIO EN EL VALLE DEL CAUCA DESPUES DE LA YODIZACION DE LA SAL
entry.dc:creator: Duque E.
entry.dc:description: After 15 yr of salt iodization, 592 thyroid glands obtained from autopsies performed in Cali, Colombia, were studied by means of serial sections. The prevalence of goiter was 19.1 distributed as follows: diffuse colloid goiter: 2.3%; colloid nodular goiter; 2.9%; parenchymatous nodular goiter 12.6% and mixed nodular goiter: 1.3%. In the first decades of life in women, colloid nodular goiter and parenchymatous nodular goiter predominated. Comparison of these results with a similar study performed in 1959 showed a global decrease mainly by diminution of the diffuse colloid and the colloid nodular types between 25 and 34 yr of age, and by a decrease in the mixed nodular type for all ages. The prevalence of the parenchymatous nodular goiter increased; this is considered a relative increase and probably due to the disappearance of the colloid component of the mixed nodular goiters observed in the first study. The persisting prevalence of the parenchymatous nodular goiter is probably secondary to the presence of environmental goitrogens. The prevalence of occult papillary carcinoma was low; 6.9%; no sex differences were encountered but a positive association was noted with goiters of the colloid types. The encountered frequency of lymphocytic thyroiditis was 6.7%, and that of focal hyperplasia of parafollicular cells of 13%.

entry.dc:title: Effect of orciprenaline and Th 1165a (fenoterol) on contractility of the human uterus during menstruation | EFECTO DE LA ORCIPRENALINA Y DEL Th 1165a SOBRE LA CONTRACTILIDAD DEL UTERO MENSTRUAL HUMANO
entry.dc:creator: Cifuentes R.
entry.prism:publicationName: Revista Colombiana de Obstetricia y Ginecologia
entry.dc:description: The effects of the beta-adrenoreceptors by sublingual route over the uterine contraction during menstruation are studied. The drugs tested were TH-1165 a (partusisten) and orciprenaline (alupent). Both drugs greatly reduced uterine contractions in all the patients. In essential dysmenorrhea besides the diminution of the contractility subjective pain disappeared. Partusisten and alupent are recommended against essential dysmenorrhea.

entry.dc:title: Effects of lactate and glutamine on palmitate metabolism in rat kidney cortex
entry.dc:creator: Barac Nieto M.
entry.dc:description: Rat renal cortical slices were incubated with [1 14C]palmitate bound to 2.5% albumin. The following effects were found: 1 mM palmitate utilization or oxidation to CO2 varied according to the concentration of lactate in the media, it increased at 0.8 and 3.2 mM, was unchanged at 8 mM, and decreased at 16 mM. Esterification was stimulated at 3.2 mM lactate. Addition of glutamine (0.1 mM) instead of lactate stimulated incomplete and complete oxidation of palmitate (1 mM), whereas high medium glutamine (10 mM) inhibited palmitate (1 mM) utilization, esterification, and oxidation to CO2 but increased its incomplete oxidation. The low rate of exogenous palmitate oxidation observed in this study and the finding that exogenous palmitate oxidation is only partially inhibited at very high concentrations of exogenous lactate or glutamine are consistent with the view that these exogenous substrates contribute little to the oxidative metabolism of rat renal cortex in vitro, which probably depends on the supply of substrates endogenous to the tissue.

entry.dc:title: Enterobacteriaceae in the jejunal microflora: Prevalence and relationship to biochemical and histological evaluations in healthy Colombian men
entry.dc:creator: Cain J.

entry.dc:title: Dispersion forces in methane
entry.dc:creator: Burnell L.
entry.dc:description: The dispersion energy of methane has been calculated by a second-order perturbation treatment. The free-electron model has been used to describe the isolated molecule, which has been assimilated to a spherical, two-dimensional box. Agreement with experiment is gratifying. © 1976.

entry.dc:title: Enteropathy in adult protein malnutrition: light microscopic findings
entry.dc:creator: Duque E.

entry.dc:title: University crisis and psychiatric disorders among students | CRISIS UNIVERSITARIA Y CONSULTA PSIQUIATRICA ESTUDIANTIL
entry.dc:creator: Perdomo R.
entry.prism:publicationName: Acta Psiquiatrica y Psicologica de America Latina
entry.dc:description: This paper describes a study on the influence of environmental stress factors upon mental health conditions of university students. The study was undertaken at the Student Psychiatric Service, Universidad del Valle, Cali, Colombia. Three periods of equal duration are compared. The first is a normal one; the others are disorderly and riotous, up to the point of forcing the discontinuance of academic activities for several months. As compared with the period of academic stability, the rates of mental disturbances show a steep rise in the periods of agitation. Schizophrenia, depression, anxiety, all kinds of difficulties in interpersonal relations, and somatic disturbances, are sharply increased, whereas complaints of less severe disturbances, like transient situational disorders, level up or decrease. Another significant rise is registered in the use of drugs for therapeutic purposes. The study leads to the conclusion that stress due to environmental disorders or social upheavals is an important factor in the aethiology of severe mental disturbances.

entry.dc:title: Tubal sterilization. 100 culdoscopies versus 100 laparoscopies. Comparative study | ESTERILIZACION TUBARIA. 'CIEN CULDOSCOPIAS CONTRA CIEN LAPAROSCOPIAS' (ESTUDIO COMPARATIVO)
entry.dc:creator: Del Corral Garces F.
entry.prism:publicationName: Revista Colombiana de Obstetricia y Ginecologia

entry.dc:title: Mortality from tuberculosis meningitis reduced by steroid therapy
entry.dc:creator: Escobar J.
entry.dc:description: In this study of 99 tuberculous meningitis patients treatment with steroids (in conjunction with antituberculous drugs) was shown to be more effective in reducing mortality than treatment with antibacterial drugs alone. Results further suggest that low dosages of steroids (1 mg/kg or prednisone daily for 30 days) are equally effective in treating the disease as high dosages (10 mg/kg of prednisone at the start of treatment, gradually reduced over a 30 day period). These results are based on sequential analysis of matched pairs, a statistical method particularly appropriate for clinical trials.

entry.dc:title: Enteropathy in adult protein malnutrition: a review of the Cali experience
entry.dc:creator: Mayoral L.

entry.dc:title: Malaria and hemogregarines from lizards of the western Caribbean islands of San Andres and Providencia
entry.dc:creator: Ayala S.
entry.prism:publicationName: Revista do Instituto de Medicina Tropical de Sao Paulo

entry.dc:title: Amenorrhea: official report | AMENORREA. PONENCIA OFICIAL
entry.dc:creator: Del Corral F.
entry.prism:publicationName: Revista Colombiana de Obstetricia y Ginecologia

entry.dc:title: 'El duende' and other incubi. Suggestive interactions between culture, the Devil, and the brain
entry.dc:creator: Leon C.
entry.dc:description: The belief in persecution or possession by evil spirits is still popular in Latin American countries. Observations were made on 12 Colombian families who were haunted by 'el duende' (a special kind of imp, goblin, or poltergeist) and other spirits. Interviews elicited a detailed account of events, a demographic and socioeconomic description of the families, exploration of the psychosocial antecedents, and a psychiatric evaluation of individual members of the group regarded as key persons. Possible psychodynamic mechanisms are involved in the production of the phenomenon and factors in the successful 'therapeutic' interventions of spiritualist rather than psychiatric or religious healers. The interaction of culture, folk belief, and the brain impaired by lesion of faulty learning appears as the important accountable dimension.

entry.dc:title: Type and time of insemination within the menstrual cycle and the human sex ratio at birth
entry.dc:creator: Guerrero R.
entry.dc:description: This paper will present data that the timing of insemination affects the human sex ratio at birth. The further question of why this is so will also be explored.

entry.dc:title: A comparison of traditional and symptom checklist based histories
entry.dc:creator: Climent C.
entry.dc:description: The authors compared the results of independent evaluations of 96 patients, each of whom was given a traditional psychiatric interview resulting in a narrative report, and a structured interview based on a self report questionnaire, resulting in a standardized report. Although the latter method produced a higher frequency of report of all symptoms, the overall accuracy of diagnoses was similar for the 2 methods. The potential benefits of the use of standardized histories are suggested.

entry.dc:title: Sequelae of Venezuelan equine encephalitis in humans: a four year follow up
entry.dc:creator: León C.

entry.dc:title: Spontaneous abortion and aging of human ova and spermatozoa
entry.dc:creator: Guerrero R.
entry.dc:description: To test the hypothesis that aging of human gametes within the genital tract increases the chance of abortion, the authors measured the probabilities of abortion after insemination on a given day of the menstrual cycle in relation to the day of the shift in the basal temperature in 965 patients. Cases came from family planning and sterility clinics where basal body temperature and coital records are kept routinely. The probability of abortion diminished significantly (P < 0.001) as the shift in temperature was approached and then increased to its highest point (24 per cent) three days later. Animal experiments have shown that aging of both spermatozoa and ova before fertilization is accompanied by higher probabilities of abortion. Present evidence indicates that this higher prevalence is also true for human beings. | The basal body temperature in 965 patients were subject to analysis with coital records in order to determine the probability of abortion after insemination on a given day of the menstrual cycle in relation to the shift in basal body temperature. Coital records were examined to assign a responsible insemination, and basal body temperature charts examined to determine a thermal shift. There were 890 term deliveries and 75 spontaneous abortions. The overall probability of abortion was 7 .8%. The lowest corresponded to Day -2 (3.2%) and the highest to Day +3 (24%). The probability of abortion diminished significantly (P less than .001) as the shift in temperature was approached and then increased to its highest point 3 days later. These results strongly suggest that aging of human spermatozoa in the female genital tract is associated with an increased frequency of spontaneous abortions.

entry.dc:title: Breast abscess | SECCION DE LOS RESIDENTES. ABSCESO DE MAMA
entry.dc:creator: Gomez Tabares G.
entry.prism:publicationName: Revista Colombiana de Obstetricia y Ginecologia

entry.dc:title: Innovations in psychiatric training | INNOVACIONES EN LA ENSENANZA DE LA PSIQUIATRIA
entry.dc:creator: Zambrano E.
entry.prism:publicationName: Acta Psiquiatrica y Psicologica de America Latina

entry.dc:title: Enteropathy in adult protein malnutrition: ultrastructural findings
entry.dc:creator: Duque E.

entry.dc:title: Use of a discharge potential scale as a monitoring technique for psychiatric patients
entry.dc:creator: Climent C.
entry.dc:description: An instrument is presented to evaluate the readiness of a psychiatric inpatient to be discharged from hospital. The basic assumption is that patients ready for discharge show changes on the different items of this instrument as treatment goes on. The study sample of 52 patients consisted of first admissions to the psychiatric Hospital in Cali, Columbia. All ratings were made by auxiliary nurses supervised by psychiatric nurses, based on observed behavior. The results of a 5 wk follow up, show that patients get discharged from the Hospital when the scores are around 60 or above, but the major score change occurs within 2 wk of admission. The findings imply that systematic monitoring of patient's progress avoids unnecessarily long hospitalization. This instrument, because of its simplicity and coverage, appears to be a useful device to assist in the process of monitoring the progress of psychiatric inpatients.

entry.dc:title: Malaria in Chordeiles minor (Aves: Caprimulgidae). An intercontinental migrant
entry.dc:creator: Ayala S.
entry.prism:publicationName: Revista do Instituto de Medicina Tropical de Sao Paulo

entry.dc:title: A MODEL FOR GASTRIC CANCER EPIDEMIOLOGY
entry.dc:creator: Correa P.
entry.dc:description: It is postulated that one major subtype of gastric carcinoma ("intestinal type ") is the end-result of a series of mutations and cell transformation begun in the first decade of life. The mutagen could be a nitroso compound synthesised in the upper gastrointestinal tract by the action of nitrite (i.e., from food or saliva) on naturally occurring nitrogen compounds. Under normal conditions these nitroso compounds do not reach the gastric epithelial cell, presumably because their synthesis is inhibited by antioxidants present in food or because of their inability to pass the mucous barrier. The barrier may be overcome by abrasives or irritants such as hard grains, food with high sodium-chloride concentration, or surfactants. Once the first mutation occurs, the glandular gastric epithelium is gradually changed to intestinal-type epithelium, the mucous barrier altered, and the pH elevated. Under these conditions, bacteria proliferate in the gastric cavity and facilitate the conversion of nitrates to nitrites, thereby increasing the nitrite pool and the probability of formation of mutagenic-carcinogenic nitroso compounds. This process of gastric atrophy and intestinal metaplasia goes on for 30 to 50 years until some of the individuals affected have the final mutation or cell transformation which allows the cell to become autonomous and invade other tissues. © 1975.

affiliation.affilname: LSU Health Sciences Center - New Orleans
affiliation.name-variant: Louisiana State University Health Sciences Center

entry.dc:title: A simplified system for surgical operations: The economics of treating hernia
entry.dc:creator: Velez-Gil A.
entry.dc:description: This paper presents a cost analysis for herniorrhaphies as they are currently performed, as compared with a new plan. The current system utilizes hospital postoperative care. The new plan involves a different utilization of hospital facilities, personnel, drugs, supplies, and postoperative home care. Costs are considerably reduced under this new proposal. Projections reveal that implementation of the new plan with the same level of present expenditures could eliminate 75 percent of the present backlog of hernias over a 10 year time period. Although the cost and disease estimates derive from an experimental study conducted at the Universidad del Valle, Cali, Colombia, this model can help meet population health care needs in any country or geographic region by basing the system of services and facilities on epidemiologically derived disease prevalence and incidence rates. © 1975.

entry.dc:title: Images of mental illness and the mentally ill among nurses in a developing country
entry.dc:creator: Micklin M.
entry.dc:description: While a number of recent studies have attempted to assess the quality and the significance of nurses' orientations toward the mentally ill, these investigations suffer from a number of inadequacies in scope and method. Utilizing less formal techniques, this study examines a variety of views on mental illness for a random sample of 114 Colombian nurses. Emphasis is placed on definitional and identifying criteria, perceived differences between persons suffering from more and less serious forms of mental disorder and several beliefs about persons suffering from mental illness. These nurses' images tend to be relatively uncrystallized and eclectic although behavioral and psychological perspectives are slightly more predominant. Variations in terms of position in the nursing division of labor and personal characteristics are minimal. Results are interpreted to indicate the lasting influence of cultural norms, on the one hand and the relatively minor influence of occupational socialization, on the other. Several directions for future research are suggested. © 1975.

entry.dc:title: Gastrointestinal blood loss in Trichuris infection
entry.dc:creator: Lotero H.
entry.prism:publicationName: American Journal of Tropical Medicine and Hygiene
entry.dc:description: Gastrointestinal blood loss was studied in six children with moderate to severe Trichuris infection in whom all other parasites had been eradicated. The children were maintained on a controlled diet. The results suggested that daily gastrointestinal blood loss is negligible in otherwise health children with heavy Trichuris infections.

entry.dc:title: Ovulation and early embryonic development in the captive vampire bat, Desmodus rotundus
entry.dc:creator: Quintero F.

entry.dc:title: The 'duende' and its victims | EL DUENDE Y SUS VICTIMAS
entry.dc:creator: Leon C.
entry.prism:publicationName: Acta Psiquiatrica y Psicologica de America Latina
entry.dc:description: This study started following a press report that a family living at Pereira (Colombia) was being haunted by a duende or poltergeist, since it seemed that some members of the family showed signs of mental disturbance. During 7 yr, 20 families were studied in the department of Valle del Cauca. Throughout the whole of Latin America there is a strong tradition concerning duendes. The duende has a round face, prominent belly, dark complexion, large teeth, and sparkling eyes. Sometimes it is naked, sometimes it wears a red or black cloak with a large hat. Its feet are turned backwards and are booted. It has remarkable stamina, its movements are quick and it is prone to antics and capering, especially when on horseback. It abhors bad music and uncanny sounds, but appreciates good music of all types. Sensitive and touchy, its anger can be devastating. It is fond of young girls and tries to win their favors. A special type of person is needed for the duende to appear; such a person seems to be the clue to the phenomena and has certain characteristics; in him, certain psychological symptoms appear prior to the occurrence of the abnormal phenomena. These include anguish, depression, convulsions, suicidal and/or homicidal drives. Additionally, there is some type of critical event in his life during the period immediately preceding the onset of the phenomena. When this 'clue person' is present the duende can appear as an image or by producing various bizarre performances: objects or pieces of furniture fly at random through the room, noises of unknown origin are produced, persons experience all kinds of physical sensations and are sometimes levitated, attacked and/or teased as if the duende were good humored or a practical joker. The duende may sometimes make erotic advances. Therapeutic measures are seldom effective; usually the priest is asked to perform exorcism. A hypothesis to explain the phenomena within the field of psychiatry suggests an extremely strained situation where all repressed forces are mobilized and freed when the person is in a state of dissociation. This hypothesis cannot explain some of the special phenomena (movement of objects): these require parapsychology and psychic research.

entry.dc:title: Association of the type and time of insemination within the menstrual cycle with the human sex ratio at birth
entry.dc:creator: Guerrero R.
entry.dc:description: With use of the shift in the basal body temperature as a reference point, a study of the effects of time and type of insemination was carried out on 1318 conception cycles. The sex ratio was found to change significantly during the menstrual cycle both in natural and in artificial insemination, although the trends were opposite. In natural insemination the proportion of male births diminished from 68% six or more days before, to 44% on the day of the shift. In artificial insemination the proportion increased from 39% three or more days before, to 62% the day of the shift. The results help to explain previous conflicting reports and suggest that environmental differences may have a differential effect on the X bearing and Y bearing spermatozoa.

entry.dc:title: Homoallyl ether rearrangement. A reaction proceeding via a cyclic eight-centred transition state
entry.dc:creator: Viola A.
entry.prism:publicationName: Journal of the Chemical Society, Chemical Communications
entry.dc:description: The thermolysis of homoallyl ethers proceeds in a concerted manner via an eight-centred transition state; thermolysis of 1-ethoxy-1-phenylbut-3-ene at 330-400° follows a first-order rate law, with Ea = 43 kcal/mol, ΔS‡ = -10 cal K-1mol-1, affording ethylene, benzaldehyde, and propene as the only products, and the corresponding butyne derivative behaves similarly, giving allene as the only three-carbon fragment.

entry.dc:title: Trypanosoma cruzi and virological studies in idiopathic cardiomyopathy in Cali, Colombia
entry.dc:creator: D'Alessandro A.
entry.prism:publicationName: American Journal of Tropical Medicine and Hygiene
entry.dc:description: During a 10 yr period a series of 114 patients was studied to determine if T. cruzi and arboviruses could be the etiologic agents of idiopathic cardiomyopathy (ICM) in Cali, Colombia. In this area, ICM (together with rheumatic and atherosclerotic cardiopathy) represents the second most frequent cause (determined by necropsy) among adult patients with cardiopathies, hypertension being the first. No association was observed between ICM and any of the arboviruses assessed by hemagglutination tests. Only 10 of 114 cases (8.7%) showed positive seroparasitological tests for T. cruzi. Autopsy was performed in 4 of these 10 cases; 1 had Chagas myocarditis and the other 3 were patients with noninflammatory ICM. In all 9 T. cruzi negative cases the autopsies showed non inflammatory ICM lesions. In contrast to typical Chagas cases, the most frequent EKG change in ICM is left bundle branch block rather than right. Since the EKG varies within either group, this distinction may not be valid in individual cases. Because of the similarities in clinical characteristics and variations in EKG between Chagas myocarditis and ICM, it is suggested that autopsies should be done in populations in endemic areas of T. cruzi to assess the frequency of ICM and its importance in the differential diagnosis of Chagas myocarditis.

entry.dc:title: Therapeutic effects of clozapine on psychotic symptoms. (Clinical evaluation using the double blind method) | EFECTOS TERAPEUTICOS DE LA CLOZAPINA (1) SOBRE LOS SINTOMAS DE PSICOSIS. (EVALUACION CLINICA UTILIZANDO EL METODO DOBLE CIEGO)
entry.dc:creator: Leon C.

entry.dc:title: Productivity and aerobic power of sugar cane cutters
entry.dc:creator: Spurr G.

entry.dc:title: Epidemiologic experiences in overdeveloped backward contries | EXPERIENCIAS EPIDEMIOLOGICAS EN SUB PAISES SUPER DESARROLLADOS
entry.dc:creator: San Martin C.

entry.dc:title: Effect of buccal demoxytocin on uterine contractility during induction of labour | EFFECTO DE LA DESAMINO OXITOCINA BUCAL SOBRE LA CONTRACTILIDAD UTERINA DURANTE LA INDUCCION DEL PARTO
entry.dc:creator: Rodriguez A.
entry.prism:publicationName: Revista Colombiana de Obstetricia y Ginecologia

entry.dc:title: Trend of cancer of the uterine cervix in Cali, Colombia | TENDENCIA DEL CANCER DE CERVIX UTERINO EN CALI, COLOMBIA
entry.dc:creator: Guzman N.

entry.dc:title: Health and health services in Colombia
entry.dc:creator: Echeverri O.
entry.prism:publicationName: Journal of Tropical Medicine and Hygiene
entry.dc:description: This paper attempts to succinctly describe the health problem in Colombia and the way solutions are being sought through existing and proposed health services.

entry.dc:title: Breeding activity, preimplantation development, and oviduct histology of the short tailed fruit bat, Carollia, in captivity
entry.dc:creator: De Bonilla H.
entry.dc:description: The reproductive biology of Carollia was investigated histologically in 113 females sacrificed at timed intervals after mating in a laboratory colony. A high incidence (44%) of non pregnant animals could be partially attributed to occasional mating activity at times other than close to ovulation. Breeding success also improved as the males and females were housed together for increasing periods of time. At least 25% of the bats had adrenal cortical like tissue in the vicinity of the ovaries. Ovulation of the single ovum usually occurred within 48 hr of the onset of female receptivity to the male. Both ovaries were functional, but there was a tendency towards the alternation of successive ovulations. The bastocyst stage was reached and the zona pellucida was lost in the oviduct between days 10 and 12 postcoitum. Blastocysts entered the uterus between days 13 and 16. The slow tubal journey of the ovum is presumably related to the occurrence of menstruation close to the time of ovulation and to the fact that most uterine growth is deferred until after ovulation. Additional ovulations and a new conception were observed during the course of several preexisting pregnancies. Differential stimulation of the 2 oviducts was evident both prior to and after ovulation. The oviductal secretory cells became engorged during the tubal journey of the ovum with a substance that was Alcian blue 8GX- and Giemsa (pH 4.5)-negative. Occasionally this material could be stained by the PAS procedure.

entry.dc:title: Pathogenic potential of Schizophyllum commune isolated from a human case
entry.dc:creator: Greer D.
entry.prism:publicationName: Sabouraudia Journal of Medical and Veterinary Mycology
entry.dc:description: Schizophyllum commune, a basidiomycete, was shown to be pathogenic for normal white Swiss mice inoculated intraperitoneally. Deaths occurred in suckling mice; weanling mice were more susceptible to infection than adults. Treatment with either cortisone or mucin or both did not alter the infection in adult mice, but cortisone rendered the weanling mice much more susceptible, causing deaths in 75%. The fungus, isolated from human tissue, invaded the lungs, lymph nodes, liver and subcutaneous tissue, producing subacute to granulomatous lesions. Cultures from these tissues were repeatedly positive and tissue sections showed penetration of the parenchyma by hyphae possessing clamp connections and sterigmata like excretory organelles.

entry.dc:title: Autoimmunity: ophthalmological aspects | AUTOIMMUNIDAD: ASPECTOS OFTALMOLOGICOS
entry.dc:creator: Villegas A.

entry.dc:title: Epidemiological studies of female prisoners. II: Biological, psychological, and social correlates of drug addiction
entry.dc:creator: Climent C.
entry.dc:description: This paper is concerned with identifying some of the factors which are associated with heroin addiction among female criminals who are already in the prison system. Types of variables studied include medical, psychiatric, and sociodemographic variables. The basic comparisons which are made are between female heroin addicts in the prison and those female prisoners who reported never using any kinds of illegal drugs. The major differences between the 2 groups seemed to be that the heroin addicts were somewhat younger, that they were less likely to be identified early as problem children in a child guidance clinic, that they had more psychiatric outpatient contacts as adults, and that they had more suicidal thoughts and suicide attempts than the nondrug users.

entry.dc:title: Disappearance of Trypanosoma evansi from a vampire bat colony in Western Colombia
entry.dc:creator: Ayala S.
entry.prism:publicationName: Transactions of the Royal Society of Tropical Medicine and Hygiene

entry.dc:title: Milk ejecting activity induced by prostaglandin F(2α)
entry.dc:creator: Cobo E.
entry.prism:publicationName: American Journal of Obstetrics and Gynecology
entry.dc:description: Prostaglandins have been shown to have physiologic effects upon several organs of the reproductive system. An outstanding example is the effect upon the uterine smooth muscle. Although there is some contradicting evidence about its action upon the mammary myoepithelium in animals, no similar action has been described on the human myoepithelium. This study describes the milk ejecting activity of prostaglandin F(2α) (PGF(2α)) in lactating women. Evidence is presented suggesting that this activity is mediated through the central release of oxytocin. Preliminary in vitro results obtained in the rat suggest the possibility of an additional peripheral effect of PGF(2α) upon the myoepithelium.

entry.dc:title: Epidemiological studies of female prisoners. II: Biological, psychological, and social correlates of drug addiction
entry.dc:creator: Climent C.

entry.dc:title: Pathogenic potential of schizophyllum commune isolated from a human case
entry.dc:creator: Greer D.
entry.dc:description: Schizophyllum commune, a basidiomycete, has been shown to be pathogenic for normal white Swiss mice inoculated intraperitoneally. Deaths occurred in suckling mice; weanling mice were more susceptible to infection than adults. Treatment with either cortisone or mucin or both did not alter the infection in adult mice, but cortisone did render the weanling mice much more susceptible, causing deaths in 75%. The fungus, isolated from human tissue, was shown to invade the lungs, lymph nodes, liver and subcutaneous tissue, producing subacute to granulomatous lesions. Cultures from these tissues were repeatedly positive and tissue sections showed penetration of the parenchyma by hyphae possessing clamp connections and sterigmata-like excretory organelles. © 1974 Informa UK Ltd All rights reserved: reproduction in whole or part not permitted.

entry.dc:title: Dermal sensitivity to paracoccidioidin and histoplasmin in family members of patients with paracoccidioidomycosis
entry.dc:creator: Greer D.
entry.prism:publicationName: American Journal of Tropical Medicine and Hygiene
entry.dc:description: Transmission of paracoccidioidomycosis infection from the patient to close family members was indicated by comparing dermal sensitivity reactions to paracoccidioidin and histoplasmin in households of patients and controls. The wives of patients were 3 to 5 times more at risk than other adult women. These findings suggest that a common source of infection other than the environment or occupation occurs in the patients' households. This source may be the patient himself. Active disease was not diagnosed in any family member studied.

entry.dc:title: Proptosis | PROPTOSIS
entry.dc:creator: Lopez A.

entry.dc:title: Isolation of rabies virus outside the human central nervous system
entry.dc:creator: Duenas A.
entry.dc:description: Rabies virus was isolated from extraneural organs of 15 of 17 persons who died of rabies in Cali, Colombia during a three year period. Among the extraneural organs examined, virus was found in the myocardium, skeletal muscle, lung, liver, and kidney. Virus was simultaneously isolated from extraneural organs and peripheral nerve, except in two cases where rabies vaccine had been given.

entry.dc:title: Hemoparasite infections in 830 wild animals from the eastern llanos of Colombia
entry.dc:creator: Ayala S.
entry.dc:description: Eight hundred thirty wild vertebrates from 3 states in the Savanna Biogeographical Region of eastern Colombia were examined for blood parasites. Of these, 229 were positive (28%) with a total of 262 infections. Findings included: hemogregarines (4%) in lizards and marsupials; malaria (2%) in lizards; filariae (7%) in rodents, marsupials, carnivores, monkeys, and lizards; piroplasms (6%) in rodents, opossums, deer, and an ocelot; and trypanosomes (11%) in marsupials, deer, monkeys, an anteater, and rodents. The parasites were identified when possible, or described insofar as the authors were able with the material available. The marsupial hemoparasite complex in eastern Colombia is similar to that of eastern Brazil, and the range extensions of several parasites reflect the zoogeographical history of their hosts.

entry.dc:title: Usefulness of traditional psychiatric history | UTILIDAD DE LA HISTORIA PSIQUIATRICA TRADICIONAL
entry.dc:creator: Climent C.
entry.prism:publicationName: Acta Psiquiatrica y Psicologica de America Latina
entry.dc:description: The purpose of this work is to compare the type of information obtained through the traditional psychiatric history method with the type of information obtained through a standardized questionnaire. The population under study was a group of 96 new patients arriving at the outpatient department and the emergency room of the psychiatric hospital during a period of approximately one month. Each patient was evaluated independently by two different groups of physicians. One group used the narrative traditional method and the other used the standardized questionnaire designed for this purpose. The results show how all investigated symptoms were reported more frequently through the use of the questionnaire than through the use of the traditional system. Alternative interpretations for this finding are discussed; some advantages and disadvantages of the standardized questionnaire are discussed. Among the advantages are the objectivity and replicability, the saving of time, the usefulness as a training and supervision device, and the fact that the patient takes active part in the recollection of the data. The major criticism appears to be the partial disagreement between the two methods regarding the diagnosis and treatment, further research is proposed and initiated in order to answer properly to this criticism.

entry.dc:title: Insect feeding behavior of some Colombian fruit eating bats
entry.dc:creator: Ayala S.

entry.dc:title: Granuloma of the liver due to Enterobius vermicularis. Report of a case
entry.dc:creator: Little M.
entry.prism:publicationName: American Journal of Tropical Medicine and Hygiene
entry.dc:description: A solitary granuloma containing eggs of E. vermicularis was incidentally found in the liver of a 54 year old man in Colombia. This is only the second report of pinworm granuloma in the liver of man.

entry.dc:title: Social and communal psychiatry | PSIQUIATRIA SOCIAL Y COMUNITARIA
entry.dc:creator: Leon C.
entry.dc:description: Social psychiatry is a study of the relationship between mental disorders affecting a given human group and the group's social characteristics. The practical application of these theoretical principles takes the form of programs of community psychiatry which seek the greatest cover of most of the population with a maximum of efficiency and economy. Investigation is needed to answer a number of basic questions prior to planning and implementing those programs. Comments are made about deficiencies of human and material resources in the Latin American region. An outline of a Pilot Project on Social Psychiatry (PPSP) developed in Cali, Columbia is presented.

entry.dc:title: Evidence for a planar transition state in pericyclic reactions involving acetylenes. A Hammett study of the thermal cleavage of β-hydroxyacetylenes
entry.dc:creator: Viola A.
entry.prism:publicationName: Journal of the American Chemical Society
entry.dc:description: The thermolysis of β-hydroxyacetylenes is reported to proceed through an intramolecular six-membered transition state in close analogy with the corresponding olefinic system. Aryl substituents at the C1 position of both systems result in identical rate accelerations, relative to the corresponding phenyl derivatives. A ρ value of -0.35, in the range of 250-280°, was determined for both reactions. Lack of any electronic differences on rate accelerations in the two systems implicates steric factors for the previously reported differences in substituent effects in the two reactions. The data support the concept of a planar transition state for the acetylenes wherein electron delocalization is centered within the plane of that transition state. By contrast, a chair-like transition state is suggested for olefins wherein orbital overlap is centered in planes orthogonal to the median plane. The consistently higher reaction rate of acetylenic analogs may be the result of greater delocalization in the planar transition state or of greater nucleophilicity of the acetylene in a concerted but nonsynchronous process.

entry.dc:title: Ligation and section of the tubes with the aid of culdoscopy | LIGADURA Y SECCION TUBARIA POR CULDOSCOPIA
entry.dc:creator: Del Corral F.
entry.prism:publicationName: Revista Colombiana de Obstetricia y Ginecologia

entry.dc:title: Epidemiological studies of women prisoners. I: medical and psychiatric variables related to violent behavior
entry.dc:creator: Climent C.
entry.dc:description: 95 women prison volunteers participated in an investigation of medical and psychiatric correlates of violent behavior. Violence was measured in 5 independent ways. Concurrence of all 5 measures was the criterion for establishing a relationship between violence and a given variable. The variables most highly associated with violence were maternal loss before age 10, severe parental punishment, neurological disorders in relatives, the dyscontrol syndrome, and easy access to weapons. These results underscore the need for a multidisciplinary approach to the study of violence rather than for investigations within isolated disciplines.

entry.dc:title: The early primary immune response to adsorbed tetanus toxoid in man. A study of the influence of antigen concentration, carrier concentration, and sequence of dosage on the rat, extent, and persistence of the immune response to one and to two doses of toxoid
entry.dc:creator: Maclennan R.
entry.prism:publicationName: Bulletin of the World Health Organization
entry.dc:description: A quantitative study was performed to determine the effect of toxoid concentration and aluminium salt concentration on the primary immune response (PIR) and the secondary response induced by tetanus toxoid in human volunteers. Four toxoid preparations having 5 fold differences in toxoid concentration, aluminium salt concentration, or both, were administered to four comparable groups of human volunteers. Antitoxin titres in the serum of each volunteer were determined at intervals. The PIR was found to be a function of the antigen concentration, the mineral concentration, and the interaction of both. The secondary response was a function of the antigen concentration; increase in mineral adjuvant concentration had no significant effect. The data suggested that the higher the postsecondary response, the slower the rate of decline over the ensuing 10 months. The distribution of primary responses at day 28 tended to be bimodal. The response to the best preparation suggested that a single dose toxoid might be developed to immunize populations that may be difficult to retrieve for multiple injections.

entry.dc:title: Electron-phonon interaction and current in strong electric fields
entry.dc:creator: Kümmel R.
entry.dc:description: Using the Houston-wave approach we investigate the electron-phonon interaction in electric fields F which are sufficiently strong to change an electron's Bloch state drastically during the relaxation time τ, but still too weak to support standing electron waves between the band edges. We calculate τ for the low density, high temperature limit and find τ∼F-1/2. The electric current in the field region of the "hot electrons" between its ohmic rise and its decrease proportional to F-1 is determined. Its increase with F+1/2 in the limit of relatively low fields agrees with Shockley's result. © 1973 Springer-Verlag.

entry.dc:title: Ulceration of the palate caused by a basidiomycete schizophyllum commune
entry.dc:creator: Restrepo A.
entry.dc:description: A Basidiomycete, Schizophyllum commune is reported as the causative agent of the mucosal lesion observed in a 4 month-old child. The laboratory findings as well as the microscopical and cultural characteristics of the fungus are described. © 1973 Informa UK Ltd All rights reserved: reproduction in whole or part not permitted.

entry.dc:title: Altruistic behavior in a sphecid wasp: Support for kin-selection theory
entry.dc:creator: Eberhard W.
entry.dc:description: Trigonopsis cameronii females often work in groups of up to four individuals on single nests, and because of inbreeding and a tendency to return to the mother nest, nestmates are likely to be highly related. The altruistic behavior associated with group living, most notably the failure to steal prey from nestmates, can thus be explained by kin-selection theory.

entry.dc:title: Psychological characteristics of frustrated suicides
entry.dc:creator: Leon C.
entry.dc:description: This study was conducted in order to determine the motivational factors and specific characteristics of those who commit suicide in Call (Colombia). For purposes of obtainining introspective information it was decided to work on "frustrated suicides", namely those persons who performed an act which would necessarily have led to their death unless opportune intervention by another person and/or medical treatment had not intervened. A register was established at the emergency room and police desk of the University Hospital (which serves 85% of the population in Cali) and all cases of suicidal behavior were reported to the study group consisting of two psychiatrists a psychologist and a social worker. During the 12 month period a total of 273 cases were reported, of which 153 were classed as "attempted", 44 were classed as "frustrated" and 76 were "consummated" suicides. In order to determine the specific psychological characteristics of the "frustrated" cases, matched controls were selected from the out patient service of the city's psychiatric hospital. Cases were matched on the basis of age group, sex, race, marital status and clinical diagnosis. A standard questionnaire was completed followed by a structured interview by a psychiatrist and administration of the Rohrschach test. The result of this study show that frustrated suicides differ litle from matched psychiatric controls. The variables on which they do differ, however, reflect feelings and experiences of maternal deprivation, inadequacy in dealing with emergency emotions and inability to function in the face of life crises. These findings may have implications for identification of specific elements in suicide and its prevention. © 1972 Springer-Verlag.

entry.dc:title: Pejibaye palm from the pacific coast of colombia (a detailed chemical analysis)
entry.dc:creator: Zapata A.
entry.dc:description: A detailed chemical analysis of the fruits of Pejibaye (Guilielma gasipaes) presented, followed by a partial amino acid analysis of the protein and a complete analysis of the fat. © 1972 The New York Botanical Garden.

entry.dc:title: Toxoplasma in animals submitted for rabies diagnosis in Cali, Colombia
entry.dc:creator: Sanmartin C.
entry.prism:publicationName: Transactions of the Royal Society of Tropical Medicine and Hygiene

entry.dc:title: Electronic structure of superconductors with dilute magnetic impurities
entry.dc:creator: Kümmel R.
entry.dc:description: The Bogoliubov equations for the quasiparticle eigenfunctions of a superconductor with isolated magnetic impurities are derived. Impurity scattering is treated in the Born approximation, and the wave functions in the spatially varying pair potential are calculated by the WKBJ method of Bardeen, Kümmel, Jacobs, and Tewordt. The pair-breaking condition is established, and the spatial variation of the pair potential at the impurity site is determined for temperatures near the critical temperature and the absolute zero. A few bound states are found in the pair-potential well. The free energy is obtained as a function of a variational parameter and shows an increase due to the energies of the pair-broken states. © 1972 The American Physical Society.

affiliation.affilname: Johann Wolfgang Goethe Universitat Frankfurt am Main

entry.dc:title: On the loop contributions to the sum rules for inclusive cross-sections
entry.dc:creator: Arrab F.

affiliation.affilname: Abdus Salam International Centre for Theoretical Physics
Abdus Salam International Centre for Theoretical Physics

entry.dc:title: Participation of acetylenic bonds in pericyclic reactions. Thermal cleavage of β-hydroxyacetylenes
entry.dc:creator: Viola A.
entry.prism:publicationName: Journal of the American Chemical Society
entry.dc:description: The ability of acetylenic systems to participate in intramolecular reactions proceeding via six-membered cyclic transition states has been established by thermolyses of a number of substituted β-hydroxyacetylenes, in both the vapor and the liquid states. Thermolyses products consisted solely of those allenes and carbonyl compounds derivable from a 1,5-hydrogen transfer. The homogeneous reactions followed the first-order rate law. Activation energies with a variety of alkyl substituents were essentially within experimental error. The activation parameters, Ea ∼ 40 kcal/mol and ΔS‡ ∼ -10 eu, are indicative of a cyclic transition state and closely parallel the parameters for the cleavages of those analogous olefins whose data are available. However, the acetylenic compounds utilized reacted at rates varying from 1.3 to 7 times as fast as those of their olefinic analogs. The effects of alkyl, phenyl, and vinyl substituents, and relative rate comparisons with the reaction of analogous olefins, are in accord with a planar transition state for the participation of the triple bond.

entry.dc:title: Reaction rates by flow system thermolysis; the competitive components of the oxy-Cope reaction
entry.dc:creator: Viola A.
entry.prism:publicationName: Journal of the Chemical Society D: Chemical Communications
entry.dc:description: The flow system co-pyrolysis of compounds, one of whose decomposition rates is known, allows the determination of the thermolysis rate of the other component; this technique has been utilized to measure the reaction rates of the individual competitive components of the oxy-Cope as well as the acetylenic oxy-Cope reactions.

entry.dc:title: The thermal decomposition of β-hydroxy esters
entry.dc:creator: Yates B.
entry.dc:description: The products and kinetics of the thermal decomposition of several β-hydroxy esters have been studied. It has been shown that all of the β-hydroxy esters studied pyrolyze to form a mixture of the corresponding ester and aldehyde or ketone and that the decomposition follows first-order kinetics and appears to be homogenous and unimolecular. Based on these data a six-membered cyclic transition state is proposed for the reaction. The absence of large substituent effects indicates that little charge separation occurs during the breaking of the carbon-carbon double bond.

entry.dc:title: PCAC and single-particle distributions
entry.dc:creator: Arbab F.

affiliation.affilname: Abdus Salam International Centre for Theoretical Physics

entry.dc:title: CYCLE DAY OF INSEMINATION AND SEX RATIO
entry.dc:creator: Guerrero R.

entry.dc:title: Renal uptake of p-aminohippuric acid in vitro effects of palmitate and l-carnitine
entry.dc:creator: Barác-Nieto M.
entry.dc:description: 1. 1. The uptake of p-aminohippuric acid by rat renal cortical slices and its relationship to the renal uptake of non-esterified fatty acids was studied. 2. 2. 1 mM palmitate competitively inhibits renal p-aminohippuric acid uptake. 3. 3. 1 mM carnitine stimulates renal p-aminohippuric acid uptake at low palmitate concentration but has no effect when 1 mM palmitate is present in the incubation media. 4. 4. It is suggested that the renal organic acid transport system participates in the uptake of palmitate by renal cells. Furthermore, palmitate and p-aminohippuric acid may share common intracellular binding sites in renal cortical cells. 5. 5. Factors affecting the affinity of intracellular binding sites, may regulate uptake of p-aminohippuric acid and uptake and metabolism of non-esterified fatty acids in renal cortical cells. © 1971.

entry.dc:title: Trypanosome infections in the family cervidae
entry.dc:creator: D'Alessandro A.
entry.prism:publicationName: Transactions of the Royal Society of Tropical Medicine and Hygiene

entry.dc:title: Tunneling into the energy bands of the intermediate state in type-I superconductors
entry.dc:creator: Kümmel R.
entry.dc:description: A tunneling experiment is proposed to verify the recently predicted band structure in the excitation spectrum of the laminar intermediate state. The theory shows that the energy bands are reflected by rapid oscillations of the differential tunneling conductance for small voltages of the order of the maximum value of the pair potential. In weak magnetic fields (H0.1Hc) which produce normal regions of some 10-2 cm, the distance between two oscillation peaks is of the order of 10-5 to 10-6 V. © 1971 The American Physical Society.

affiliation.affilname: Johann Wolfgang Goethe Universitat Frankfurt am Main

entry.dc:title: Electronic structure of the intermediate state in type-I superconductors
entry.dc:creator: Kümmel R.
entry.dc:description: The quasiparticle wave functions and the energy-eigenvalue equations of the intermediate state in extreme type-I superconductors are calculated for the full range of the excitation spectrum. A WKBJ method of solving the Bogoliubov equations at any temperature below Tc is used. The periodicity of the pair potential leads to Bloch-type wave functions and a band structure of the energy spectrum for fixed momenta parallel to the phase boundaries. The magnetic field has an effect on the quasiparticle energies only by its influence on the structural and thermodynamic properties of the system. The width of the normal regions, and an effective variation length summing up the space dependence of the pair potential, are the variational parameters of the theory. From the general eigenvalue equations explicit energy spectra are obtained for simplified models of the pair potential. © 1971 The American Physical Society.

affiliation.affilname: Johann Wolfgang Goethe Universitat Frankfurt am Main

entry.dc:title: Thermal decomposition of β-hydroxy esters. Ethyl-3-hydroxy-3-methylbutanoate
entry.dc:creator: Yates B.

entry.dc:title: Assessment of instruments for studying the prevalence of mental disorder
entry.dc:creator: León C.
entry.dc:description: A sample from the population of El Cerrito was assessed for mental disorders by means of the Health Opinion Survey questionnaire filled in by respondents, a check list completed by an informant and, in a sub-sample, a psychiatric interview. The mean H.O.S. score does not differentiate between the mentally disordered (assessed at interview) and others, nor give a clue as to diagnosis. However, the mean score of the mentally disordered is significantly lower than that of the well. The check list does identfy a small proportion of the mentally ill individuals but gives no information about type of disorder. A second psychiatrist agreed with the diagnosis of the first (using the same collected material) in a satisfactory number of cases, but the two psychiatrists did not agree on the indication for psychiatric treatment. © 1970 Springer-Verlag.

entry.dc:title: Excitation spectrum of a paramagnetic-superconducting contact
entry.dc:creator: Kümmel R.
entry.dc:description: A calculation of the bound states in a paramagnetic-superconducting contact, valid at any temperature below Tc, is performed by using a recently developed method of solving the Bogoliubov equations. The problem of self-consistency of the pair-potential Δ(x) is being avoided by leaving open the detailed form of Δ(z), introducing instead the characteristic lenghth for the spatial variation of the pair-potential, d=O∫D(1-Δ(z)/Δ)dz, as a fit parameter. The energies, the quasiparticle wave-functions and the density of the bound states are calculated for negligible impurity scattering. The energy gap of the excitation spectrum reduces from about one third of its bulk value to practically zero as the thickness a of the normal film increases from a≪d to a≫d. © 1970 Springer-Verlag.

affiliation.affilname: Johann Wolfgang Goethe Universitat Frankfurt am Main
